'''Windows Store''' is an upcoming [[online distribution|digital distribution]] platform developed by Microsoft Corporation as part of [[Windows 8]] for [[Metro (design language)|Metro]]-style apps.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.softpedia.com/news/Get-Insight-into-the-Windows-Store-in-Windows-8-226006.shtml|title=Get Insight into the Windows Store in Windows 8|accessdate=2011-10-19|date=2011-10-06|publisher=Softpedia|author=Marius Oiaga}}</ref> The Windows Store will also allow developers to advertise their Win32 or "traditional desktop" applications, but the store will only provide links to the application's website.
+
'''Windows Store''' is an upcoming [[online distribution|digital distribution]] platform developed by Microsoft Corporation as part of [[Windows 8]] for [[Metro (design language)|Metro]]-style apps.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.softpedia.com/news/Get-Insight-into-the-Windows-Store-in-Windows-8-226006.shtml|title=Get Insight into the Windows Store in Windows 8|accessdate=2011-10-19|date=2011-10-06|publisher=Softpedia|author=Marius Oiaga}}</ref> The Windows Store will also allow developers to advertise their Win32 or "traditional desktop" applications, but the store will only provide links to the application's website.{{fact}}
On September 13, 2011, day one of the BUILD developer conference, Microsoft's Windows President Steven Sinofsky announced the Windows Store app and its features and demonstrated the store. Although the publically available Windows Developer Preview includes the Windows Store app, it does not function and simply displays a "coming soon" message.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.techairlines.com/2011/09/18/windows-8-developer-preview/|title=Windows 8 on a laptop in-depth preview (video)|accessdate=2011-10-19|date=2011-09-16|author=Dana Wollman|publisher=engadget}}.</ref>
On September 13, 2011, day one of the BUILD developer conference, Microsoft's Windows President Steven Sinofsky announced the Windows Store app and its features and demonstrated the store. Although the publically available Windows Developer Preview includes the Windows Store app, it does not function and simply displays a "coming soon" message.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.techairlines.com/2011/09/18/windows-8-developer-preview/|title=Windows 8 on a laptop in-depth preview (video)|accessdate=2011-10-19|date=2011-09-16|author=Dana Wollman|publisher=engadget}}.</ref>
